title: storage capacity
extract: Storage capacity refers to how much disk space one or more storage devices provides. It measures how much data a computer system may contain. For an example, a computer with a 500GB hard drive has a storage capacity of 500 gigabytes. A network server with four 1TB drives, has a storage capacity of 4 terabytes.Aug 13, 2009
extract_html: Storage capacity refers to how much disk space one or more storage devices provides. It measures how much data a computer system may contain.
